quest.name: Saving Captain Gairhard
journal: Timbermaster Beatin is in great distress.

Beatin has been inconsolable since the discovery of Gairhard's broken bow. Believing his dear friend to be deceased, he asks that you give him time to be alone. Speak with Nicoliaux and see if he has any ideas as to how you can comfort the timbermaster.

Nicoliaux tells you of how the timbermaster flew into a terrible rage upon receiving word of Gairhard's presumed death, breaking anything within reach with his bare hands. Although Nicoliaux believes the situation to be hopeless, he suggests that you present a length of high-quality rosewood lumber to Beatin, in an effort to distract the timbermaster with work.

Your attempt to distract Beatin unexpectedly triggers the revelation that Gairhard and his squad must still be alive. However, the timbermaster fears that his friend is in dire need of assistance. Unable to grip a saw due to the injuries he incurred while rampaging through the workshop, he asks you to craft a quality crab bow and meld to it a grade three savage aim materia. Once you have prepared the bow, track down Gairhard in the North Shroud and see that he receives the help he needs.

You fortuitously stumble upon Gairhard's squad, which is locked in battle with the Ixal. Amazed by the inexplicable appearance of a carpenter in the middle of a battlefield, he is shocked to receive the crab bow. After sparing the briefest of thanks, he turns his attention to the Ixal and promptly slays their leader with a single arrow. Their forces in disarray, the Ixal are forced to retreat. Return to Gridania and inform Beatin of all that has transpired.

Beatin thanks you profusely for saving Gairhard's life, and states that he owes you a debt that can never be repaid. He furthermore declares that you have grown into a master artisan, and that he has nothing else to teach you. Inspired by your example, the timbermaster resolves to refine his own skills, and wishes you luck in your never-ending journey to become a better carpenter.

※The next carpenter quest will be available from Beatin once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Present a length of rosewood lumber to Beatin.
Deliver a crab bow melded with a savage aim materia III to Gairhard in the North Shroud.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! It's horrible! It's so horrible!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: An officer from the Adders' Nest came to speak with me. In the North Shroud, near Ixali territory, they...they found...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Gairhard's longbow!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I saw the fragments myself. It was the selfsame maple longbow I made all those years ago. Which means...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: He... Gairhard is...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I wish to be alone right now, Forename. Go... Be with your loved ones, or play with the younglings in the Acorn Orchard.

dialogue.name: NICOLIAUX
dialogue.text: Hey, Forename. It's good you weren't here earlier when Beatin heard the news. He went on a rampage in the workshop, howling like an animal and breaking anything within reach with his bare hands!

dialogue.name: NICOLIAUX
dialogue.text: I don't think we can help him this time... But if you want to try, you could give him some really, really good wood─like, say, the best length of rosewood lumber you can make. Maybe that would work?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Why...why have you returned? I told you, I wish to be alone.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: This...this is...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: This is an exquisite length of rosewood lumber. Truly, the culmination of decades of growth and maturation...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: <sigh> I know you mean well, Forename, but it is no use. My thoughts remain with Gairhard.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Like a young sapling, he matured into a magnificent tree...only to be cut down before his─

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: ...Wait, what am I saying? Gairhard was no sapling. He was one of our finest. And the scouts...the scouts found signs of a skirmish, but no bodies!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Do you not see? He must still be alive! He and his squad are out there somewhere, isolated and likely low on supplies. I know for a fact that he only carries one bow, so if that weapon has been broken... Matron forfend, he could be defenseless!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: He must needs be sent a new one straightaway! But...I fear I am in no condition to craft it. In my earlier foolish tantrum, I injured my hand, and have not the strength to grip a saw.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: You must be the one to craft Gairhard's bow, Forename. I beg of you, make him a peerless crab bow and affix to it a savage aim materia of the third grade.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Once finished, seek out Gairhard and his men in the North Shroud. The fragments of his old longbow were found not far from Alder Springs. If the Matron is merciful, you will find him not far from there.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Please, Forename. You are my one and only hope.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: What do you think you're doing here!? Take cover, you fool─there are Ixal about!

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Dammit, Forename, this is no place for a carpenter!

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: A bow? Did Beatin send you all this way just to deliver a bow?

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: That... He... Gods bless that stubborn fool!

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: I should have listened when he said my maple longbow was at its limit.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. If it weren't for you, I don't know what I would've done.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Now keep your head down! I've a chieftain to slay!

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Ngaaah!

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: You saved lives this eveday. I cannot thank you enough, Forename. Please let Beatin know that we are fine, and that I will see him again soon.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I could kiss you, Forename! He lives! Gairhard lives!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I owe you a debt that can never be repaid. A thousand times over, I thank you.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: You came to us as a seedling, yet now you are as a heavenspillar. There is naught else I have to teach you.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: In fact, you have inspired me to reflect on mine own deficiencies.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Minor though they may be, I would be remiss if I neglected personal development. Though you are no longer under my tutelage, I trust you will continue to hone your craft as well. Best of luck to you, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the carpenter quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next carpenter quest will be available from Beatin.

obj.n: Gone till the Sixth Astral Moon
